result.execSummary:
The defendant Luke Allen Tyler Voigt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Probation may be transferred to Lincoln County.

miscConds.notes: Maintain GFE in full time employment/schooling or combination of the two.  When not fully engaged, complete 15 hours of community service per week.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Complete any assessment, treatment, counseling deemed necessary by agent.  DNA sample. 

Handgun was legally owned by Lacey Carlson and to be returned to Ms. Carlson and will not maintain handgun at her premise and will transfer possession of handgun to her father; William Pease.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Clerk: Kimberly

INCLUDES 15CF817 & 15TR4360 (tracking)
State appears by ADA Ralph Uttke.  Deft appears with Atty Austin Mort.

Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.
State moves to:
Amend criminal complaint in 15CF817 to misdemeanor statute 941.23 Carrying a concealed weapon 
15TR4360: Ct. 1 Speeding in 55 MPH zone (1-10 MPH) >> dismissed
COURT grants above

PLEA: 
15CF817:
Ct. 1 Carrying a concealed weapon >> NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made,  factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: w/hold sentencing. 9 months probation. Probation may be transfered to Lincoln County where deft resides. CONDITONS: Complete any assessment, treatment, or counseling deemed necessary by agent. Maintain GFE in full time employment/schooling/combination of two, when not fully engaged complete 15 hours of community service per week. Pay CC. Pay DNA sample and surcharge. Hand gun was legally owed by Lacey Carlson and be returned to Ms. Carlson and will not maintain hand gun in her premise and will transfer possession of hand gun to her father- William Pease. 4 days credit granted if revoked.
